TEXT.English: [TAB]The main duty of the king in Vedic civilizations was to protect the tribe. He was aided by two functionaries, the "purohita" (chaplain) and the "senani" (army chief; "sena": army). The former not only gave advice to the ruler but also practiced spells and charms for success in war. Soldiers on foot ("patti") and on chariots ("rathin"), armed with bow and arrow were common. The king employed "spasa" (spies) and "duta"s (messengers). He often got a ceremonial gift, "bali", from the people.
